title: size_of function doesn't work with with type parameters (or else bogus error message about `Z
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::mem::size_of;
fn f<T: Sized>(t: T) {
    let x: [u8; size_of::<T>()];
}

fn main() {
    f(0u8)
}
```

I expected to see this happen: Either for the code to compile cleanly or to give a sane error message. 

Instead, this happened:
```
error[E0277]: the size for values of type `T` cannot be known at compilation time
   --> trashc.rs:3:27
    |
2   | fn f<T: Sized>(t: T) {
    |      - this type parameter needs to be `Sized`
3   |     let x: [u8; size_of::<T>()];
    |                           ^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
    |
   ::: /Users/mike/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/mem/mod.rs:303:22
    |
303 | pub const fn size_of<T>() -> usize {
    |                      - required by this bound in `std::mem::size_of`
```

### Meta
